content.1: In that day shall this song be sung in the land of Judah; We have a strong city; salvation will God appoint for walls and bulwarks.
content.2: Open ye the gates, that the righteous nation which keepeth the truth may enter in.
content.3: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
content.4: Trust ye in the LORD for ever: for in the LORD  JEHOVAH  is everlasting strength:
content.5: For he bringeth down them that dwell on high; the lofty city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.
content.6: The foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy.
content.7: The way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost weigh the path of the just.
content.8: Yea, in the way of thy judgments, O LORD , have we waited for thee; the desire of our soul is to thy name, and to the remembrance of thee.
content.9: With my soul have I desired thee in the night; yea, with my spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thy judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
content.10: Let favour be shewed to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness: in the land of uprightness will he deal unjustly, and will not behold the majesty of the LORD .
content.13: O LORD our God, other lords beside thee have had dominion over us: but by thee only will we make mention of thy name.
content.15: Thou hast increased the nation, O LORD , thou hast increased the nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst removed it far unto all the ends of the earth.
content.17: Like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in thy sight, O LORD .
content.18: We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it were brought forth wind; we have not wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
content.19: Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise. Awake and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thy dew is as the dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.
content.20: Come, my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee: hide thyself as it were for a little moment, until the indignation be overpast.
content.21: For, behold, the LORD cometh out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall disclose her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.
